thread.title: New Jersey wins its fourth game in row
thread.title_full: New Jersey wins its fourth game in row - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: New Jersey wins its fourth game in row
text:
Photo: Gary Wiepert Image 1 of / 1   1 New Jersey Devils left winger Adam Henrique celebrates a short-handed goal during the third period of an NHL hockey game against the Buffalo Sabres, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Buffalo, N.Y. New Jersey won 4-3. (AP Photo/Gary Wiepert) ORG XMIT: NYGW106 New Jersey Devils left winger Adam Henrique celebrates a short-handed goal during the third period of an NHL hockey game against the Buffalo Sabres, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Buffalo, N.Y. New Jersey won 4-3. ... more New Jersey wins its fourth game in row 1  /  1 Back to Gallery Buffalo 
Adam Henrique scored twice and added an assist and New Jersey beat Buffalo for its fourth straight victory after an 0-3-1 start.
Mike Cammalleri had a goal and two assists, David Schlemko also scored, and Cory Schneider made 26 saves for the Devils.
Tyler Ennis, Ryan O'Reilly and Jack Eichel scored for Buffalo. Linus Ullmark made 24 saves in his NHL debut for the Sabres. Buffalo lost Evander Kane to an apparent left leg injury.
Islanders 3, Blues 2 (OT): Mikhail Grabovski scored his first goal of the season four minutes into overtime and New York beat St. Louis. John Tavares scored his fifth of the season.
Flyers 3, Rangers 2 (SO): Sam Gagner and Claude Giroux scored in a shootout. Mark Streit and Scott Laughton scored in regulation, and Steve Mason had 37 saves for the Flyers. Mason stopped Dominic Moore to end it. J.T. Miller and Derick Brassard scored for the Rangers.
Canadiens 5, Maple Leafs 3: P.K. Subban and Max Pacioretty each had a goal and an assist and Montreal extended its season-opening winning streak to nine games. The Canadiens are a victory away from tying the NHL record set by the Maple Leafs in 1993-94 and matched by Buffalo in 2006-07.
Blackhawks 1, Lightning 0 (OT): Jonathan Toews scored his first goal of the season 17 seconds into overtime to give Chicago a victory in a rematch of last June's Stanley Cup Finals.
Penguins 2, Predators 1 (OT): Phil Kessel scored 41 seconds into overtime to give Pittsburgh a win. Chris Kunitz had the other goal for Pittsburgh, which won for the fourth time in five games.
Panthers 6, Stars 2: Nick Bjugstad had a goal and an assist after moving up to the top line, and Florida beat Dallas.
Coyotes 4, Senators 1: Mikkel Boedker scored three goals and Arizona snapped a four-game skid.
Wild 3, Ducks 0: Devan Dubnyk stopped 15 shots for his first shutout this season and Minnesota sent Anaheim to its sixth loss in the first seven games.
Blue Jackets 4, Avalanche 3: Ryan Murray and Brandon Dubinsky scored goals early in the third for Columbus in its first win in nine games this season.
Notes: The Blues' Jaden Schwartz will miss 12 weeks with a broken left ankle.
